column2: The people of Indonesia worship the one god Yang Maha Esa, who they believe rules over the sky in the form of Garuda, the King of Birds, and the earth in the form of Paduka Tuan, the King of Men. As people spend all their lives in service of Yang Maha Esa - serving Paduka Tuan in life and Garuda in death, they believe that in order to prove themselves worthy of flying with Garuda in the skies above Heaven, they must live their lives diligently following the Five Precepts as laid down by Paduka Tuan - guided by justice, civility, inner wisdom, belief in fellow man, and belief in God. Only by understanding the relationship between oneself and God can one realise that they are different, yet still one - just like the Indonesia that Paduka Tuan gifted to them long ago, and they may yet work to restore it and the unity it brought to mankind.

Vaishnavism, the worship of Vishnu as the Supreme Being and his ten primary avatars, used to be one of the largest Hindu sects prior to the Event. The most prominent feature is the still-prevalent caste adherence in Vaishnavist communities. Additionally, the ninth avatar of Vishnu varies, with the most predominant one being Buddha, and regional variants including Jagannath and The Mahatma. However, with the worship of Krishna as the supreme (and sometimes only) god rising in popularity, its number of adherents has been reduced greatly. Nonetheless, Vaishnavism may one day dominate Hinduism once more.

Not so much a singular faith as a blanket term for various disorganised faiths and practices across eastern India. The most common binding belief is that Shiva, who struck down the old world for their decadent ways, is the Supreme Being. Shakta tradition also has noticeable influence, with Shiva often being portrayed as the male reality of God while Shakti (in various forms) is the female reality. Local deities, such as Jagannath, are frequently worshipped. Tantric ritualism and low priestly influence are defining characteristics. Though worship most commonly takes places in village shrines, old temples are meticulously maintained and frequently used as pilgrimage sites.

Though originating from before the Event, worship of Krishna as the monotheistic God under the name Svayam Bhagavan has almost completely overtaken Vaishnavism since then, rejecting Krishna as an avatar of Vishnu. Though Bhagavan-Krishna is considered the sole Supreme Being, adherents frequently worship various aspects and forms of Krishna. Bhakti tradition also holds high value in Bhagavatism, with ritualism being largely replaced with popular worship through song, festival, and dance among other devotional traditions. As a result, the Varna system has been highly de-emphasised and brahmin influence has dropped greatly since the Event.

Smartism follows the teachings of the scholar-saint Adi Shankara. Though originating from before the Event, Smartism has come to dominate South India by syncretising various Hindu sects into the philosophical tradition of Advaita Vedanta. The Smarta tradition is largely controlled by the brahmins, who uphold philosophical orthodoxy through a centralised priestly hierarchy. The head of the Smarta priestly hierarchy is the Shankaracharya. Smarta worship features strict rituals called yajna administered by the brahmins, and usually venerates five deities with equal value - Vishnu, Shiva, Shakti, Ganesha, and Surya.

Shaiva Siddhanta is a school of Shaivism found primarily in Tamil Nadu in southern India. The central belief is the existence of three universal realities - the Lord (pati), the soul (pashu) and the soul's impurities and bindings in existence (pasha), those being karma, ignorance, and maya (delusion in reality). Adherents believe that ritualism and devotion (bhakti) are the path for one's soul to be free from its bindings. Veneration of Shaiva saints, regional deities and Tamil poets are also present. After the Event, it grew to be the dominant Hindu sect in Tamil Nadu.

Jagannath is the Lord of the Universe of the jungles and hills of eastern India. Some say he is a manifestation of Vishnu, others that he is a fierce form of Shiva, but all will agree that Jagannath is an unstoppable force - the will and embodiment of the universe and brahman itself. Along with his brother Balabhadra and his sister Subhadra, they represent all the consciousness, energy, and knowledge of the universe respectively - a great triad equivalent to Para Brahman. Jagannath is an abstract concept, the personification of the void, present everywhere all at once. He is celebrated in great chariot processions called Ratha Yatras and worshipped in the form of vividly decorated painted wood icons. For centuries, the followers of Jagannath have been persecuted by armies of invading faiths, considering their Lord to be a demonic force, his temples being desecrated and his worshippers massacred and driven out in droves. Nonetheless, Jagannath's faithful do not intend to lay down and die, their tradition being one of the most militant in all of India.

The Saurya tradition of Hinduism worships the Sun god Surya as the Saguna Brahman and Supreme Being. Surya is the Lord of the Trimurti and the absolute reality of the world. Worship of Surya dates back to the Vedas, particularly the Gayatri Mantra, a sacred mantra dedicated to Savitr - God of the Sunrays. He is depicted as riding a chariot through the sky pulled by seven horses, and is worshipped in tandem with other gods throughout various periods of the day - alongside Brahma in the day, Shiva at noon, and Vishnu in the evening. Surya is also worshipped in the Makarasankranti, a lavish festival celebrating the transition of the Sun from the dhanu zodiac to the makara, thanking Surya for prosperity and new beginnings. Though one of the oldest Hindu deities still worshipped, veneration of Surya declined greatly before the Event - and his followers believe it is for this reason the Sun itself fell down to Earth and struck the Old World down.

The Risala Khalida is a movement within Sunni Islam, seeking to lead the people of the book to salvation under God. The failure of traditional Muslim sects to unify the ummah has made Islam the weakest it has been since the Jahiliyyah. The people of the Eternal Message hold that the Prophet was sent to the Arab nation to unify it as a lawgiver, abolishing tribalism and asabiyya and protecting the Arabs from encroaching imperialists. Under the Prophet and the Rashidun, all Muslims were equal under God, free from the greed and exploitation that other empires fall to. Thus, Islam must once again be freed from its struggles by a great leader, one that will follow in the footsteps of the Prophet and free the ummah from this modern Fitna. They see each of the religious traditions descended from Abraham as valid ways to salvation, universal and inherent to the belief in an infinitely merciful God, though it is Islam which now holds the responsibility of liberating the Muwahhidun of the Near East.

The Ardhanarishvara cults worship the god Shiva together with his consort Parvati. Shiva represents the male reality of the universe, whereas Parvati represents the female reality, together representing the inseparability of the male and female principles of God.

The Saraswati cults are primarily devoted to Saraswati, the goddess of knowledge, art, and music. She is one of the physical manifestations of Mahadevi and is worshipped by Buddhists and Jains as well as Hindus.
The cults of the minor devas are devoted to an assortment of less popular regional deities found across eastern India, and village deities called gramadevatas.

The Jagannath cults are primarily devoted to Jagannath, most frequently worshipped as a fierce manifestation of Shiva and the god of annihilation. To Vaishnavists, he is an abstract representation of Vishnu or Krishna and sometimes worshipped as the ninth avatar of Vishnu. The annual Ratha yatra festival is held in Jagannath's honour.

Donyi-Polo is the indigenous animistic and shamanic religion of the Tani and other Tibeto-Burman peoples of Arunachal Pradesh and Assam in Northeast India. The name "Donyi-Polo" means "Sun-Moon", and was chosen for the religion in the process of its revitalisation and reformation shortly before the event into a system of decentralised temples that nonetheless uphold a unified canon of their faith.

The native Gond religion, Koyapunem meaning "the way of nature", was founded by Pari Kupar Lingo. In Gond folk tradition, adherents worship a high god known as Baradeo, whose alternate names are Bhagavan, Kupar Lingo, Badadeo, and Persa Pen. Baradeo oversees activities of lesser gods such as clan and village deities as well as ancestors. Baradeo is respected but he does not receive fervent devotion, which is shown only to clan and village deities, ancestors, and totems. These village deities include Aki Pen, the village guardian and the anwal, the village mother goddess, a similar paradigm to folk traditions of other Dravidian peoples. Before any festival occurs, these two deities are worshipped. Each clan has their own persa pen, meaning "great god". This god is benign at heart but can display violent tendencies.

Kirat Mundum, is the animistic folk religion that is indigenous to the Kirati ethnic groups of Nepal, Darjeeling and Sikkim, primarily practiced by Yakkha, Limbu, Sunuwar, Rai, Thami, Jirel, Hayu and Surel peoples in the north-eastern Indian subcontinent. It is a unique blend of shamanism, animism, ancestor worship and Shaivism. the religion primarily centers around the male and female manifestations of the supreme being Tagera Ningwaphuma those being Theba Sammang and Yuma Sammang which will occassionally reincarnate on earth in human. The religion was reformed in the century prior to the event into a series of interconnected but nonetheless independent temples and monastaries which withstood the turmoil of the event well and following the apocalypse spread to become the sole religion of the Kirati peoples once again.

Sanamahi Laining or Meiteism, is an ethnic religion of the Meitei people of Manipur in Northeast India. It is a polytheistic religion that is named after the God Lainingthou Sanamahi, one of the most important deities of the Meitei faith. Sanamahi is the eldest son of the supreme god Yaibirel Sidaba and the supreme goddess Leimarel Sidabi. Traditionally every Meitei household, irrespective of the religion, worships Sanamahi and Leimarel Sidabi. Following the event the faith has become extremely aggressive towards other religions wishing to convert those who forcibly converted their God-King Sanamahi's adherents.

Sarvodaya, meaning "universal uplift" is an Indian post-Event movement that arose after the fall of Indian democracy. Described by contemporary scholars as something between a religion and a philosophy, adherents of Sarvodaya consider themselves the true successors of the Indian state. While their beliefs are still largely Dharmic in nature, considering all Hindu gods valid manifestations of Brahman or Shakti, they are ultimately secular, not encouraging or discouraging any worship among their followers. Sarvodaya adherents worship a wide variety of gods, Hindu or otherwise, but a curiosity in their lands is the notable lack of state-funded temples, with the religion having no formal religious hierarchy and any religious temples being privately upkept. Philosophically, Sarvodaya largely draws inspiration from the teachings of the legendary Mahatma, with an extremely strict adherence to ahimsa and vegetarianism. Additional key sages in Sarvodaya are Vinoba Bhave, Nehru, and Shrimad Rajchandra, among others. Politically, Sarvodaya fiercely advocates for "swaraj" - the concept of self-rule. While some consider this to mean self-rule of countries against foreign powers, the most often interpreted meaning is the self-rule of the populace against the political state both morally and economically. As a result, Sarvodaya realms are often republican and elective in nature, and tyranny is rarely tolerated. Additionally, Sarvodaya adherents are frequent practitioners of satyagraha, the practice of nonviolent resistance. Sarvodaya satyagrahis frequently attempt to achieve positive social changes throughout India to varying levels of success.

The Concordianist Church considers itself the sole legitimate successor of the greatest polity the Old World had ever seen - Europa itself. From the days of Charlemagne all the way to the Event, wise Europa functioned as one, unified in diversity. Though Europa has since fallen, they believe she is destined to rise again, as she has many times before. Thus, the Concordianists do not believe it is the destiny of any one man to unite the whole continent by his hand, but rather the collective destiny of all of Europe, once they come to realise their strength in unity. Guided by the many Fathers of Europe, such as Plato, Kant, and Hegel, who themselves have been guided by the divine hand of Providence, the Concordianists, though fallen far from grace, now comprise some of the greatest artists and philosophers in post-Event Europe. Throughout many courts of Europe can be heard the odes to the glory of Europa Regina, reinforcing the fact that though she may have ceased to exist as a polity, she forever lingers on as an idea in the hearts of men. Those whose souls have been touched by the pan-European ideals of the Concordianists venture to Brussels, where Europa first embodied herself as an angel atop a white bull, and a grand cathedral was built atop the hill where the old institutions are buried. Together, they work towards the return of a unified Europa, the Daughter of Elysium.

A form of Islam native to the Indian subcontinent. Ahmadi Muslims believe that a messianic figure known as the Mahdi, named Ahmad, came down to India before the Event, announcing that the people must repent and turn back to the True Islam, or else be destroyed. To those who accepted him he showed the new way of peace, and proclaimed that Islam would no longer be spread by the sword, but by more peaceful means. To those who rejected him, he issued condemnations. The Event then fell upon the people for their lack of faith, while the chosen people remained safe, hidden from the wrath. Now, under the guidance of their Caliph, the Ahmadiyya go forth once again, to preach the religion of peace to every corner of the ruined world.

One of the first organised religions founded after the Event, Amaitism is a syncretic faith founded by the prophet Amaité in southern California. Amaitists claim that their prophet was formerly a Zoroastrian, given divine revelation by Ahura Mazda. Amaitism states that Ahura Mazda consists of a trinity, with the great prophets of history - Zoroaster, Jesus and Buddha - being emanations of the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit respectively.  Jesus is the Son of God, whose great sacrifice removed the original sin from mankind, and Zoroaster and Buddha are prophets who spent their days teaching the common man how to enter Heaven by escaping the cycle of rebirth that all humans are otherwise destined for. For each aspect of the Trinity, Ahura Mazda created a counter - forces of chaos meant to bring balance. Angra Mainyu created the material world, Satan created the sins of man and Mara created the cycle of rebirth. Without each divine aspect having its opposite, the world cannot function. Amaitists also believe non-believers can enter heaven, though they have a harder time doing so by rejecting the teachings of Amaité, as it was revealed to them that the great religions of the world are merely single aspects of a single God's plan. Depictions of Amaité are forbidden, the line being drawn at an androgynous figure with a burning face, as they were never an emanation of God, merely a messenger. As such, their final request was for them to be forgotten, not wanting to be deified themselves.

Sarnaism is a folk religion practised primarily by the Kurukh and Munda peoples and spread throughout the Chota Nagpur plateau in eastern India. Claiming to be an ancient belief system existing since time immemorial, Sarnaism, known locally as Sarna Dhorom and to outsiders as the Religion of the Holy Woods, is a nature worshipping pagan faith largely detached from surrounding Hindu and Abrahamic religions. Though syncretism is commonplace, Sarnaists reject the Varna system and ignore any foreign religious texts, instead turning inwards, focusing on protecting and nurturing the nature around them. Having a vast and inconsistent amount of deities and spirits, the most frequently worshipped supreme creator is the Sun, known as Dharmes, a force of unquestionable good. The sacred Sarna grove is of especial importance, and it is believed the groves are the abode of Chala Pachchho, a powerful female deity commonly identified as a mother goddess of earth and nature. Once a year Sarnaists observe the Sarhul festival, a three day period of celebration in which adherents celebrate marriage between the Earth and the Sun and offer sacrifices to village deities.

The supreme deity of the Sarna religion is the Sun god Dharmes, who is believed to be the force of unquestionable good in the world, hampered only by human vices. Sarnaists believe that the old world was struck down by Dharmes as punishment for mankind's destruction of nature, and consider it their main duty to preserve and protect nature from those who wish to exploit and destroy it. Once a year Sarnaists observe the Sarhul festival, a three day period of celebration in which priests called Pahan offer sacrifices to the mother goddess Chala Pachchho and ancestral spirits, celebrating marriage between the Earth and the Sun.

Islam in China goes by many names - "Orthodox religion", "Cubic religion" or simply "Hui religion", but one word that is used by its followers to exemplify its virtues is "Qingzhenjiao", or the "Pure and True Religion". Due to its isolation from the wider ummah by successive Chinese governments, the Muslims of China have adopted peculiar practices influenced by the local Confucian and Daoist philosophies and other new Chinese religious traditions, such as ancestor veneration and a generally Confucian social outlook. In fact, many Muslims in China consider Confucius on par with the Prophet Muhammad, dubbing him the "Sage of the East" as opposed to the Prophet's status as the "Sage of the West". They will often translate Islamic concepts using Confucian terminology, culminating in the near-syncreticism of Confucianism and Islam present in many of their religious works, such as the Han Kitab, or the use of Taoist clothes by certain members of their Sufi orders.

Ak Jang is an indigenous religion that flourished among the Altai people of Russia's Altai Republic during the 1900s. The Russian Empire was suspicious of the movement's potential to stir up native unrest and perhaps involve outside powers and thus suppressed it. The religion was originally millenarian, charismatic and anti shamanic, the movement gradually lost most of these qualities becoming increasingly routine, institutionalized and accommodating itself to the pre existing Altaian folk religion. It is derived from a combination of Tengriism, Buddhism and Khurmaztism.

Wunggurr is a name denoting the underlying lifeforce of the world among the Indigenous nations of the Kimberley. To the believers in the Wunggurr, their land was created by Wolaro, a deity who alone divided the world into two moieties - Bramalar and Bronor. He told the animals, rocks, plants and ancestor spirits to which moeity they would belong to, passing down the male line. Spirits known as Wandjina also play an important role among the Kimberley Clans. The Wandjina are protective and totemic spirits contained within rock paintings who are maintained and repainted by local peoples. They appear in many of the creation stories of the land. Additionally, there is reverence for the Rainbow Serpent Lumuru, who is a servant to Wolaro. Lumuru delivers spirit-children into the womb of women, making them pregnant, and transforming said spirit into flesh and blood.

One of the native surviving folkloric religions on the island of sulawasi its largest group of adherents are to be found amongst the Torajan people. The religion believes in a variety of dieties though all are in some manner considered ancestors to the human population of earth. The world is divided into the underworld, the Earth and heaven, the ancestors of humans having descended from heaven in ancient times. The earthly authority, whose words and actions should be cleaved to both in life and death , is called a To Minaa. Aluk is not just a belief system, it is a combination of law, religion, and habit. Rastafari is the religion of the Rastas, founded in Jamaica. They are worshippers of Jah, the God of all. According to them, the Event was caused by the decadent forces of Babylon getting struck down by Jah, in the form of Ras Tafari, the manifestation of Jah and the Emperor of Zion. In the distant reaches of Asia, Ecumenical arose as a unifying movement among scattered Protestant groups left behind after the Event. It emphasizes core Reformation principles while embracing doctrinal diversity, allowing various Protestant traditions to coexist under their shared faith. Ecumenical churches adapted to include the local practices of all Far East Protestants thus leading to highly varied practices compared to other Protestants, yet they remain united by Scripture, Grace, and Faith. This false prophet was none other than the antichrist who deceived the people of Spain that he had been sent by God Himself to restore the worship of the Lord and eradicate the wicked and degenerate from this land. The church in Spain instead of seeing through the lies of the antichrist, blinded by their hatred, wholeheartedly supported the antichrist, shepherding the people of Spain straight into the jaws of the beast. The antichrist demanded from the people their praise for being sent by god under threat of death for anyone who refused, the slaughter was such that he founded lakes and rivers throughout Spain with the blood of his victims. Fortunately the Lord did not abandon his people and sent his archangel Raphael to kill the antichrist, after which he punished the world with the event.

It took years of looking for and reading rotten antediluvian documents from the years before the Event for the procedure on what to do if this scenario happens. At last, the various archbishops of Asia knew what to do, and with the knowledge from the documents and support from other archbishops around Asia during the First Council of Manila, the former Archbishop of Manila has been declared Patriarch of Asia.

Even before the Event, some schismatic Filipinos wanted to have a seperate Filipino Catholic Church separate from Rome, akin to the Church of England, more known as the Anglicans. Now with the chaos of the Event, the Aglipayans, more centralized thanks to the severed connection of the Philippines and Rome, are now more vocal than ever with their goal of an independent Philippine Church separate from Rome.

Originating in the Philippines, the El Shaddai are a herbalistic group that believes in folk healing with herbs and the power of God. Their heavy usage of herbs and a questionable amount of practices foreign to the Katoliko faith make the El Shaddai popular amongst people who want to syncretize Catholicism and their various traditions.

The Sea Creed faith is more a loose group of superstitions from the Atlantic and the Mediterranean. The corsairs of those seas hold together their crews through the fear inspired by the risks of going against the Code of the Sea, and of course against their ruler. Most rulers turn a blind eye on the acts and rituals of the Sea Creed, especially because the Corsairs bring in a fair profit.

The Sea Creed in the North Atlantic tends to favour a much different set of beliefs compared to warmer shores. Calling themselves "children of Ragnarök", the vikings of the northern seas hold that the Event was Ragnarök come to end the world. The prophecies foretold came true one by one, with the Old Gods being slain in the great calamity. The world serpent Jörmungandur poisoned the water and sky and ended life as the Old World knew it alongside Surtur and Fenrir. The world survived their onslaught though, and though the Old Gods perished in their twilight, their kindred came to inherit their roles and end Ragnarök. Thus, the New World is watched over by Baldur and Hod, who lead a new pantheon of benevolent deities, while the Old Gods are all either dead or mere husks of their former selves. They are often malevolent and considered signs of bad luck, unable to let go of a world that moved on.

Born long before the Event in the mountains of Switzerland, the Reformed Churches follow the Protestant tradition as laid down by the great sage Calvin and his like-minded reformers. The Calvinists strongly believe in the concept of predestination, in which the salvation of men is pre-determined by God long before their judgement. This belief extends to the question of rule, with many Calvinists believing that he who is not destined to go to Heaven is not destined to rule either.\nThe Church itself was supposedly never claimed by the fires of the Event, being saved by the legendary Emperor Jürgén from destruction. The Council of Geneva marked a turning point during those early days of the deluge, establishing Geneva as the home of the Church's Elder and the Calvinist Theocracy as the only valid form of temporal government. Soon after, the rest of the European Reformed Churches were brought back into the fold, and since then the Calvinists have been organising, preparing to sally forth from their mountains and retake what is rightfully theirs.

The Roman Catholic Church survived through the Event, like it did through so many other crises, great and small. It did not, however, come out unscathed. Though the state of the Church during the Event is murky at best, the Holy See was officially restored in the Year 2100, with the Keys of Heaven being given to Saint Adalbertus, the first legitimate successor to pre-Event Pope John Paul II. The Church has had many losses, losing large swathes of territory to pagans, heretics, and idolators, as well as suffering from the Sevillian Schism, where the faithful of Spain flocked to a rival Pope in Seville. Since then, the true Holy See has adapted to the post-Event world accordingly, allowing the marriage of priests and the appointment of female deacons to make up for the massive loss of life during the Event, as well as recognising a variety of local rites and the celebration of Vernacular Mass. Now, the Church may finally, for the first time in a long time, have the upper hand against its neighbours, and only time may tell if it will survive in this new changing world, as it has for countless millennia.

A ancient faith first revived on the Aran islands of Ireland, spreading to the nearby Galway, Mayo and Sligo. While not a direct successor, it has survived somewhat in the background of Ireland's long Christianization. It worships the spirits which inhabit all places in the world, having returned from the otherworld where they were banished by the Christian Saint Patrick. The event destroyed the barriers he put in place allowing the spirits to return once again. Of particular worship are water spirits as they give life. The ruler of these fae is Lir, Old King of the Sea, and his Swan children. The rulers of this faith are also Draoithe themselves and as such are permitted to directly hold temples.

Genevism is a Calvinist movement founded, according to legend, right after the Event during the reign of Emperor Jürgen the Holy. The Genevists are named after the Council of Geneva, in which all Calvinist priests in Europe attended. The Council announced the proclamation of the Calvinist Theocracy as the official form of governance for the Alpereich, which caused a number of priests to storm out, leading to their excommunication and the subsequent founding of the Genevese Church. Following this schism, the Genevese Church eventually took more radical stances regarding Calvinist politics, advocating for total separation of the realm of God and the realms of men. According to the Genevese, all of God's laws cannot be realistically enforced on Earth, and as such Theocracy cannot be the ideal way to govern as it is fundamentally flawed. Though their popularity has waned in the years after the Council, relegating them to near obscurity, Genevese thought may yet be revived once theocratic rule fails the Calvinist faithful.

This distinct sect of Judaism, practiced by the Betah Israeli Jews of Ethiopia has too survived the Event. Their Biblical texts have a few additions to the usual Jewish Bible. After the event, several old customs were revived, such as the unique monastic traditions that differ from the traditions of other Jews.

Zoroastrians worship Ahura Mazda, the uncreated God, as proclaimed by the ancient Iranian prophet Zoroaster. It was the official religion of all Persian empires (except the Hellenic Seleucid Empire) until the Muslim conquest of the Sassanid Empire in 651. The ancient form of the religion involved great sacred hill top fires and the exposure of dead bodies to scavenger birds for cleansing, while the modern form of this religion instead mainly focuses on the following of its primary creed, "Good Thoughts, Good Deeds, Good Words." As such, they are very generous and charitable despite the fact their religion has seriously declined in its number of adherents. The two largest surviving communities can be found in central Iran and Western India, though there was an attempt at revival in the Yarsan Kingdom of Kurdistan in recent history.

Based on a collection of texts uncovered by a Zoroastrian Priest in late 23rd century Tajikistan. This faith holds that the god of time Zorvan is father to both Ahura Mazda and Angra Mainyu and that Zorvan guides humans destiny through various celestial implements. One key difference between this sect and its ancient forebearer is that it contends that Humans must have free will otherwise the command by Ahura Mazda to do good is pointless, thus a divine being would not state such. The faith looks slightly more favourably on Angra Mainyu than traditional Zoroastrianism due to him being one of Zorvan's sons. Additionally they believe that Zorvan's sons must both exist for there to be a universal balance, they believe that there can be no good without evil and no order without chaos to compare it to, while Ahura Mazda is the sibling worthy of worship Angra Mainyu should be respected for the role he plays in the natural order of Zorvan's weave. Because of these beliefs it was driven from its Tajik homeland by its fellow Zoroastrians and the religion found popularity amongst the Sarikoli. The religion generally speaking is not aggressive and if not for it's aggressive neighbours would continue residing amongst its mountain tribes.

Dating back to the early days of Islam, the Qurani believe that Islamic law and guidance should only be based on the Koran, thus opposing any religious authority of the hadiths as well as caliphs. It is their belief that God's message in the Koran is clear and complete as is and that it can be fully understood without referencing outside scriptures. In the post Event era, the Qurani are heavily persecuted and often branded as apostates. They themselves view other Muslims as corrupted and seek to bring Islam back to its original form.

Jawi is a blanket term for the syncretic school of Sunni Islam which developed in the Nusantara region. Named after 'Al-Jaza'ir Al-Jawi' which is the term used by Arabs for the Nusantara region. Originally found on the isolated fringes of Islamic society, the combination of Islam and various Indonesian and Malay native beliefs, spirituality, mysticism and shamanism has since gained a widespread following ever since the Event. Shamans, known as the dukun to Indonesians and the bomoh to the Malay, have an important role in society, considered to be healers and diviners. Weather shamans, known as the pawang, are believed to control the weather and tame wild beasts. There is a special emphasis on ancestral heirlooms, which are believed to house the spirits of ancestors and must be protected, and can give their owners extraordinary powers. Other than venerating the spirits of ancestors, the Jawi also believe in a wide variety of supernatural entities, ranging from ghosts, known as the hantu, to imps, goblins, and familiars, all of which would either aid them or harm them through contracts and witchcraft. Despite incorporating a large amount of native beliefs and being denounced by mainstream Muslims as blasphemers and profaners, the Jawi faithful still firmly consider themselves Muslim, believing that only a powerful and pious Grand Sultan can firmly unite Nusantara once more.

Santri is an Islamic sect originating in Nusantara. Named after the students of pesantren, a type of traditional religious boarding school which played a pivotal role in the spread of Islam, with the position of local Ulamas and Imams being held in high regards, especially for guidance and religious authority. Largely the same as pre-Event orthodox Sunni Islam, the Santri sect has managed to largely avoid internal religious conflict and major distortions to theology through adaptation of local Malay folklore and practices to fit Islam instead of the other way around, with . Despite outward insistence on religious cohesion and Shafi'i legalism, private worship of Santri Islam tends to have many esoteric Sufist and mystic rituals, including the veneration of ancestral and nature spirits and the religious consumption of cannabis. Following the Event however, the loose hierarchical structure of Imams have caused the Santri sect to be in theological battle against the syncretic Jawi sect, which threaten to erase the Santri way of life.

Ramadi is a syncretic sect of Islam developed in the Sunda islands after the Event, soon after spreading via trade far throughout Southeast Asia. Mending Hindu-Buddhist and Muslim beliefs, the Ramadi believe that both Muhammad and Buddha were prophets of Allah in their own equal right, and that they both achieved Nirvana, hearing the divine word of Allah and successfully living to spread it to the world. Thus, the Ramadi believe that it is possible for any ascetic to, in theory, receive the word of God by reaching Enlightenment, though none have succeeded. The person to successfully do so would be the prophesied Rama-Buddha, a great ruler destined to bring forth a new Messianic Age and establish the Pure Land of Allah.

In the times before the Event, on the isolated communities within Vietnam and Cambodia, are the Cham with their own Islamic faith. Over time the message of the Prophet was adapted into something uniquely their own, combining traditions, beliefs and practices from the various faiths of ancient Champa. This adaptation fostered a vibrant spectrum of schools which came from different interpretations and teachings coming from elders of the community. A key unifying event is the Ramuwan festival, where villages gather to commemorate the ancestors and martyrs through feasting. Despite minor differences, the divine message of Po Awloah is clear, that the faithful must live a righteous and truthful life to achieve eternal peace and harmony.

Navayana is a school of Buddhism founded in the decades leading up to the event. Its founder, Bhimrao Ambedkar was born a Hindu, but however following his study of the Buddha's teachings he became convinced of its truth. He found that all currently existing schools of Buddhism had become overly esoteric and no longer thought the Buddha's lessons as he would have wished them. As such he created the "Buddh aur unaka dhamm" which was a recounting of the Buddha's teachings and life with the addition of commentaries added by Ambedkar. This was meant to remove some of the esotericism which had developed in the previously existing sects.

For many Jews, the idea that the post-Event world would usher in the Messianic Age held little importance in their lives. Their priority lied in the concept of "tikkun olam", the rebuilding of the world, and they saw it as their responsibility to restore the order, prosperity, and enlightenment held in Old World ideas lost to the Event. These reformists, inspired by the Maskilim of old, gradually grew more influential within Israel, and tensions with the pro-Messiah old guard boiled over when many of the Haskalah leaders decried the Mashiach ben David as a fraud. Their followers were subsequently hunted down and either killed or exiled, their ideas found a new home within the more cosmopolitan coast of Israel after the Messiah's death, earning Haskalah Jews a reputation for their tolerance all throughout the Mediterranean.

New Karaites are a sect of Jews that inherited the old Karaite traditions of following the Tanakh as the sole supreme authority in theology and halakha. They do not recognise the Talmud, Oral Torah, or any piece of Jewish Oral Law as any more binding than other religious texts, believing that the written Torah as passed down to Moses by HaShem is the ultimate scripture. A sort of "via media" between Eastern European Jews, where personal study and interpretation of the Torah is encouraged for each individual believer, freely choosing whether to accept the rulings of the Sanhedrin and subsequent Rabbis. Thus, the New Karaites are an umbrella of two major internal groups - those who stick closely to the traditions laid down by the Old Karaites, and those who accept the teachings of Rabbinical Judaism. They are nonetheless united under one Jewish identity, and both groups' synagogues are managed by the Council of Sages, the highest Jewish authority in all of Eastern Europe.

A heresy spawned from just before the event from the theology of Father Matta El Meskeen. He came to blows with the Coptic papacy over the nature of original versus personal sin and the importance of personal faith in god over that of the collective faith in the church. He believed Original sin prior to Jesus was something that an individual could overcome through good deeds and that after the crucifixion one could overcome original sin by either accepting Jesus as their savior or through their own good deeds. As such Mattaists are extremely charitable to their impoverished citizens. He also believed in the total separation of the church and the state such that the church would not interfere with state policies. Overall the importance he placed on personal faith and his critiques of the Coptic church led to Mattaists believing post event that they no longer needed a papacy to govern them.

The Neo-Fraticelli, or 'New Little Brethren', is a Catholic heresy that was inspired by records of a medieval heresy of the same name. It is devoted to poverty and asceticism - especially for men of the cloth. Fraticelli heretics are violently opposed to Church wealth and displays of opulence among the populace. This is due to Mammon Prince of Greed being viewed as the demon King of the old world, he grew so powerful as to overthrow Lucifer Prince of Pride himself. He brought about the fall of the old world intentionally therefore the sin of greed is considered as fatal, if not more than, pride. They see the old world as a society of Pharisees who, instead of helping those in need, separated from them because they bothered their hearts.
Now that Egypt is finally in Coptic hands, we can use this momentous occasion to move the Papal seat back to its ancient home of Alexandria, ending the centuries long exile.

Mandaeism or Mandaeanism, also known as Sabaeanism , is a monotheistic and gnostic religion with a strongly dualistic cosmology. Its adherents, the Mandaeans, revere Adam, Abel, Seth, Enos, Noah, Shem, Aram, and especially John the Baptist. The name 'Mandaean' is said to come from the Aramaic manda meaning "knowledge". Within the Middle East, but outside of their community, the Mandaeans are more commonly known as the Subba or Sabians. The term Subba is derived from the Aramaic root related to baptism, the neo-Mandaic is Sabi. Occasionally, Mandaeans are called "Christians of Saint John".

Legends have long spoken of the Marble Emperor. It is believed that during the final days of the Romans, the emperor Constantine was blessed by God to drive back the invading hordes of barbaric Huns and Goths. For centuries, the divine Emperor fought against all odds to save his Empire. It is said once he was finally felled in battle, a host of the Lord's angels descended from the Heavens. Saint Michael himself declared him the "Marmaroménos vasiliás", before turning the last Emperor into a statue made of marble, and burying him deep under the walls of Constantinople where he sleeps. This is so that when the world nears its end, and the forces of evil triumph over those of good, the Marble Emperor may finally awaken to unite the Lord's flock and lead them to salvation as their divine and immortal Emperor.

Neo-Huguenots believe that all rulers are in the service of God, and God only. Any ruler not deemed to serve God and the people are to be named tyrants, and overthrowing them is not only necessary, but a divine right. They believe that if every tyrant is removed from the face of the Earth, eternal prosperity will come to it, and so they try to go on grand campaigns to rid the world of these scum. Neo-Huguenots are heavily inspired by the Monarchomach theorists of pre-event France and consider tyrannicide to be a necessity in the fight for equality before God. They see feudalism as a tool for self-serving monarchs to consolidate more power for their selfish interests, so instead they follow a theocratic government where only the most pious and altruistic get to rule. The Queen of the Thelemites is considered to be the embodiment of a tyrant and her followers demon worshippers, and Novelists are known to have first brought back feudal law after the event, and so both are the main targets of Neo-Huguenot incursions. Catholics and other Protestants are both viewed with heavy distrust, as they both adhere to feudal structures and are also blamed for the destruction of the original Huguenots, a bitterness that never faded.

For Post-Judgmentists, the deprecated state of the world is a sure sign that Judgment Day had already come, and the people of the world have been left behind. They hold that the Event that ravaged the world was indeed Last Judgment, though they ponder why in that case had the dead not been revived and the righteous called upon by the Father. There are different interpretations for why this happened: some say that the Lord took his righteous, which numbered few if not none, leaving the rest behind. Others say that the armies of Heaven and Hell battled upon Armageddon as the Holy Book prophesied, and the forces of evil triumphed, leaving mortal men under an eternal dominion of Satan. Whatever the reason may be, the future is bleak, and Post-Judgmentists fervently believe that humanity must rebuke their banners and their vices. Only when the people recognise God as the only true King, can they pray that he returns to bring them into Heaven.

A post event religion from across the Atlantic and near the Great Lakes, the Four Guardians faith has a deep connection to the cycles of the world and its natural power. Principally, there are only five truly divine beings in its cosmology, the Five Thunderbirds. The four lesser birds rule over each of the four winds and the greater Thunderbird, their father, rules over all creation. The four seasons of the year are ruled by four demi-gods - Paul Bunyan the Sower of Spring, Minne the Mistress of the Great River, Jack O'Lantern the Headless Bringer of Fall, and Father Christmas, who both rules over winter and delivers the Child, which is a representation of the new year being born following the battle between King Boreas and Vulcanus Rex.

The Aurorean faith is the disparate belief system of the coast and sea-dwelling Alaskans, spread widely across their homeland in the North Pacific, and varying wildly from city state to city state. The faith holds that there are three tiers of great spirits in their pantheon. The greater gods are aspects of Ellam Yua, the spirit of the universe, in the form of the Celestial Ram, the Earthly Ewe, and the Annointed Lamb, are beyond the mortal world of men and are the creators and orchestrators of the Earth, the sky, and all of life's symphonies. The lesser gods, such as the Raven and the Thunderbird, are those who live in the spirit world as mediators between the world of man and the world of gods, and control much of the earthly realm on the greater gods' behalf. Lastly are the various animistic spirits who inhabit the earth, sea, and sky, such as dwarfs and gnomes, and most importantly of all, the Aurorean Heavenly Host, a great army of spirits marching across the sky for which the religion is named. Aurorean shamans attempt to invoke the spirits for good luck, good weather, and bountiful seas, and the vast and elaborate creation stories of the frozen north are frequently retold at potlatches.

They believe in the sea trinity of Arnakuagsak, Sassuma Arnaa and Nerrivik, the three rulers of the sea. Other gods include the unnamed Røde Sømand, the stone-faced Qooqa and the great Martin Jaegeren, while the evil gods include the wrothful Adlet, the ferocious Amarok and the vengeful Tupilaq. Its followers give great importance to the act of hunting and the respect of the spirits.

Its followers give great importance to the act of hunting and the respect of the spirits. Now that the faith has been reformed it is impossible to say the direction it will take.

column2: The Gallicanist Papacy was formed in the year 2205, with the last Patriarch of Québec proclaiming himself Pope Bien-Aimé I. The Québécois Patriarchate was one of many positions in the newly-formed Council of Patriarchs, meant to hold Catholicism together in total absence of papal contact. Claiming to have received an apparition from the Blessed Virgin, the now-Pope declared the old Papacy forfeit, and forced a massive schism in the Catholic Church of Canada, with many bowing to his word as the new Vicar of Christ, and many more denouncing him as a fraud and a heretic. Ultimately, the Gallicanist Church held its own in the aftermath of ecclesiastical controversy, spawning a new line of American Popes. Whether or not this neo-Catholic Church will survive the eventual backlash of old Catholicism to come its way remains to be seen.

Less a religion and more of a collection of philosophic ideas, Constitutionalism is the main doctrine by which the government of the United States operates under. Favoring a pragmatic mix of clemency and ruthlessness to achieve hegemony over the east coast of North America, Constitutionalists are applying their doctrine into their policies of governance to great effect.

Consisting of the remains of the Catholic Church in the United States, due to little to no contact with the Papacy in Rome, they resorted to self management under the newly formed Latin Patriarchate of Washington sponsored by the federal government. While the Latin Patriarch is no Pope, he is the highest Catholic religious authority on US soil.

The Levant has long been home to several Christian denominations,such as the Assyrian Church, Chaldean Catholics, and Oriental Orthodox. These churches had few or no theological differences, and were mostly distinguished by which Rite they used to celebrate the Liturgy. However, after the Event, these differences no longer seemed as significant as the need for cohesion and survival in the face of societal collapse, and so the Syriac Orthodox and Chaldean Catholic Churches joined together. This 'new' old Church is led by the Patriarch of Antioch and All the East.

Where Nobelians believe in the use of Knowledge for peace, Dynamiters consider it a mean to bring glory in battle. This fringe movement claims that war is the greatest of all arts of man, and endeavors to rebuild the great weapons of destruction that made humanity invincible. Following teachings that are believed to come from the great master of war they call the Merchant of Death, they will endeavor to bring back the glory of humanity's power of science, dedicating it to the art of war and destruction.

The Kalevalalaulu faith is an offshoot of ancient Finnish paganism which experienced a resurgence in the lands of Finland and Karelia in the years since the Event. Fusing traditional belief of the Sami, Finnish and Karelian people, the Kalevalalaulu faith is endemic to the region, and focuses more on protecting Finland, Karelia and the lands of the Sami, rather than expanding outwards. Yet, so far no conqueror has ever managed to take those northern lands, and all believers share the faith that it is thanks to the teachings of Ukko and Ilmatar and the bravery of their followers.

Russian folklore found a place to thrive in the post-Event world. Inspired by the tales of great heroes, from the bogatyrs of old Rodina to the campaigns of the Witcher-King, the Russian tundra over time developed a complex pantheon and belief system comprised of various deities and mythical creatures. The main deity is Trigolov, the Three-Headed God, who created the Earth by tricking Dyavol. The Earth is personified as Rodina, the mother goddess and creator of life. Other gods found in the prayers and altars of the far north include Veles, the god of witches and magicians, and Dazhbog, the Sun. Just as important as the gods are the folk heroes immortalised in the tales still told around bonfires, and to the tunes of bard songs. Figures such as Egoriy the Brave, who slew the cruel dragon Tugarin, or Ilya Muromets, who defeated the bandit Solovey, are prayed to for good luck, bravery, and guidance.

Gelugpa, or 'Yellow Hat' Buddhism is one of the traditional schools of Tibetan Buddhism and has absorbed many of the other schools in Tibet since the Event. It originated from Mahayana Buddhism,and retains many of its traditions,including an emphasis on Bodhisattvas and their intervention in the lives of believers. Traditionally,the Gelugpa are led by the Dalai Lama, but long ago the Panchem Lama was captured by the Chinese, preventing him from recognising the reincarnation of the next Dalai Lama. As a result, the traditional means of selecting the Dalai Lama was abandoned, and he is now elected by a council of Lamas from around Tibet.

The Three Precepts - Minsheng, Minzu, and Minquan - were written and compiled by Father Zaizhi, named Guofu by his followers. As the main guiding principles in every man's life, the Principles state that one should be wholly dedicated to his people, their rights, and their livelihood. By living according to the Three Precepts, one will find harmony with themselves and by extent the world, thus being able to help uplift their fellow man and let him live according to his own spiritual rules and maxims. It is said once everyone embodies the Precepts, and the universe finds itself in true harmony, Heaven will reunite with Tianxia, and give mandate for all people to be named Sons of Heaven.

The Path of the Eternal Flame is composed of the teachings that Yan Di, the Flame Emperor, gave to his people, compiled by the ancient sages of the Hong Dynasty. It states that Yan Di ruled over all of Tianxia not as an Emperor, but as an equal, a wise teacher gifting them the fires of industry and agriculture as instructed by Heaven. After his passing, he was invited to rule over Heaven, leaving behind Tianxia to his descendants - the xian, so they may be its stewards in his stead. However, the Hong rulers soon grew fat and decadent, each subsequent Son of Heaven elevating himself to a higher level of divinity. Before long, Yan Di was outraged by the royal court, and he sent the Eight Armies to strike them down. The only thing that remained in the ashes were their followers - the Liehuo, who swear to never repeat the mistakes of their ancestors. Guided by humility and progress, they wish only to find the perfect sage of Hong descent, so they may collectively receive Heaven's mandate once again, restoring harmony with the universe and Tianxia itself.

Taoism is the ancient religious and philosophical framework of China, traditionally regarded as being founded by the Old Master Laozi. Drawing from ancient Chinese mythology, the core belief of Taoism is the Tao - the source of all existence and the path taken by it. The goal of all Taoists is to cultivate and live their Tao, manifesting their inner virtue and living in harmony with themselves and the universe. This is accomplished through meditation, alchemy, ritual sacrifice, and holistic medicine. Through successful self cultivation and mastery of the Tao one can hope to become a sage, achieve immortality, or ascend to the Heavens. Heaven itself emanates from the Tao, being ruled by the Three Emperors - venerable lords of Jade, Ruby, and Sapphire, appointed to succeed the Pure Ones as rulers of Tian.

The Raven Tales are the creation myths of many of the indigenous groups of the American Northwest Coast. They speak of Raven, a supernatural shapeshifting trickster, who is said to be the creator of humanity and, in some myths, the world itself. One story speaks of how Raven stole the Sun, Moon, and stars from the Sky Chief, who was keeping it away from people. Another story says that Raven freed the first humans out of a clam. That being said, while he is often credited with creating the world and liberating humanity, Raven does not do things out of the goodness of his heart, but to satisfy his curiosity and boredom, being always hungry for vanity.\nOther gods also frequently make their appearance in the Raven Tales, such as the Ocean Woman, the goddess of fertility and abundance of fish in the sea, and the twin deities Ta'xet and Tia, who represent violent and peaceful death respectively. Killer whale spirits are considered rulers of the underworld and reincarnations of deceased ancestors. These Raven Tales are passed down during the potlatch, a ceremonial gathering held to mark important events, such as the birth of a child or passing of an elder.

The Jacobins, members of a secret society in the highest echelons of European academia, are those who live to placate the eternal hunger of Madame Guillotine. Jacobins believe that many years before the Event, the prophet Robespierre was given this sacred duty by the Madame herself, but was soon killed by those unbelievers who considered him a madman. With Madame Guillotine left unfed, it was humanity that paid the price, the Madame taking back all the lives owed to her in the Event. With rivers of blood painting the streets of Europe red, the Jacobins slowly reemerged and reorganised, seeking to right the wrongs of their ancestors. Though denounced by the Girondins from whom they branched out of, and driven underground by the many other faiths of the continent, the Jacobins have slowly built up a web of informants and volunteers in Europe's universities, and only need the right time to strike.

The Communards are those Girondins who reject the First Estate as the one given mandate by God. Instead, they believe a ruler cannot uphold his duties if he isn't even of the same Estate, and as such they believe the only Estate capable of ruling over the Third Estate is itself. Communards believe only the lowest echelons of society can uphold Liberty, Equality, and Fraternity, for they are the only ones who know what life is like without them. They also insist that Madame Guillotine will never be satisfied if she is fed the lives of those who have nothing to give, for it is the fat and the rich she yearns for. Thus, the Communards haven't only given themselves the noble goal of peasant liberation, but also believe it is their divine right to feed the whole of the First Estate to Madame Guillotine. As such, the Communards are heavily demonised and feared by the rulers and faiths of Europe, and rightfully so - for they have no compassion for the ruling classes and ask for none in return. When their turn comes, they will make no excuse for the terror to be unleashed.

The Church of Saint Tito, though having deep roots in the folk beliefs of the Balkans, had only recently been codified with the formation of Jugoslavija. For centuries after the Event, the states of the Balkans have suffered from wars and subjugation, just as they have many times before. In times like those, the disunited Catholic, Orthodox and Muslim peasants were briefly united in prayer towards a single mythical, shining hero - Marshal Tito. Ancient folk tales speak of the Prophet-Marshal, how he was directed by God himself to unite the squabbling tribes of the Balkans, and teach them the ways of Brotherhood and Unity. With the help of his great generals Jelachich and Karadjordje, Marshal Tito wrestled the vast plains of Pannonia from the tyrannical Ugars and the rolling hills of Raka from the hordes of Osman, and founded the first true Empire of Jugoslavija on the crossroads of Europe, guided by the principles of Brotherhood and Unity. The rebelling of the Yugoslavs against the hordes of Makedon, just as they have done many times before, has led to the codification of the many myths of Marshal Tito's heroism This led to the creation of a new holy book, one that reduces the roles of Jesus Christ and the Prophet Muhammad, and replaces them with the Prophet-Marshal as the true Messiah and the Seal of the Prophets, much to the chagrin of the people of Jugoslavija, who consider it a politicised perversion of their ancient faiths.

The Karmapa or 'Red Hat' school of Buddhism was once simply another form of Tibetan Buddhism, considered equally valid alongside the others. However, when the Chinese captured the Panchem Lama, they produced a new Panchem Lama, a Han Chinese man whom they claimed to be the true Lama (called 'the Red Lama' by Tibetans). Most Tibetans rejected this 'new Lama', but some accepted him. This led to a rift in the community, as it was no longer clear who the real Panchem Lama was, thus the traditional means of selecting the Dalai Lama could no longer be used. Those who followed the Red Llama came to be confused with the historical 'Red Hats' school, and now even the knowledge that there used to be another group called by this name has been forgotten.

Katerinist belief states that the Great Holy Spirit and Mother Russia are two equal aspects of the divine energy of the universe, one being masculine and the other feminine. They believe that while the Spirit created the world, Mother Russia created man, and in Her own image gave women the divine power of birth and motherly love. As such, they hold that, just as man is born from a woman, so too were great Russia, its golden age and its glory born from Catherine the Great, the Divine Mother. Katerinists claim that, while every Tsar is blessed by the Spirit, only the Tsarina-Mother was truly divine, and perfect evidence that women are the natural leaders of mankind. Contemporary Tsarists, however, do not believe that Mother Russia is a literal deity, believing the name to merely be a metaphor for the Great Holy Spirit.

The Khanists of the Mongol steppes primarily worship the legendary hero Temüjin, who in ages past conquered the whole world under one great Empire and became Chinggis Khaan - the Universal Ruler - thus ascending to divinity. Chinggis Khaan is said to be the incarnation of Ochirvaani, the Vajra-Buddha, and like the thunderbolt bestowed upon him he tamed the endless plains of Eurasia in merely a lifetime. Once his time on Earth was at an end, he ascended to become the universe itself, and it is said that all mortal men are descended from him. Thus, he is worshipped not just as the universal ruler, but also as the universal ancestor, and all ancestral offerings are given to Chinggis Khaan as well as family members. Despite the ages of Temüjin's conquests being long past, the Khanists still hope that one day he will incarnate on Earth once more, and restore the Universal Empire lost in the ashes of the Event.

Descendants of the antediluvian religious orders of Lutheranism, their organization and military history carried them through the times of turbulence and back into prominence. Requiring strict discipline of their followers and of the priests they recreated their bishoprics across the major kingdoms, which in turn flowed into the militaries and economies of the enterprising rulers. At the core of it all was the reconquest and reformation of the Archbishopric of Lund, who, while hotly contested by rival kings for control of them, seek to reassert their power of the faith as a whole.

Laestadianism is a pietistic movement within Lutheranism founded by pre-Event preacher Lars Levi Laestadius. Pietism places especial focus on individual piety and virtue, with Laestadianism advocating for a sinless, spiritual life, free from worldly vices and material greed. Simplicity and worldlessness are important in the every day life of Laestadians, with vanity being frowned upon, as a lavish lifestyle is considered sinful, as well as drinking, dancing, and bodily modifications. If knowingly sinned, a faithful believer should confess to another believer, so that his sins may be forgiven in Jesus' name and blood.

The Church of Enchanted Beings, named after the concept of "väsen", claims to be the successors of millennia old traditions of the European North. Though functionally Christian, centuries of distortion have rendered them a completely separate religion. Emphasis on oral traditions and folk stories have pushed its Biblical aspects into less and less importance, while belief in the supernatural and the hidden has become key parts of everyday life. The unifying part of this folklore is belief in hidden magical creatures, such as gnomes, trolls, and elemental spirits. Protector spirits and patron deities are also frequent and vary from region to region, of note is the presence of several severely distorted Aesir amongst the regional mythologies.

The Einblicker, or the "Insightful", are an esoteric movement that believes they hold the true history of the world. They adhere strongly to the god Adonis, who was created by Monad long before the age of man alongside his consort Dido. However, Adonis was killed and defeated by his brother Moloch, who sent unto the Earth many plagues and a Great Flood, and revealed himself to false prophets, masquerading as the true god. Under the guise of the One, Moloch demonised Adonis as the Devil, and through the faith of his followers kept control over the Earth for millennia. However, Adonis spent ages regaining his strength until finally retaking control of the Earth and defeating Moloch once and for all. In preparation for the great cataclysm to ensue, Adonis revealed himself to the true mystics and prophets of the world, such as Hermes Trismegistus and Christian Rosenkreuz - considered the Fathers of the Einblickers.\nThough the war in heaven caused great destruction on Earth, known to many as the Event, the true faith endured, its most faithful adherents now being delvers into what they consider the true nature of Monad and Adonis. They live without without strict moral code, believing the pleasures of life are gifts from Adonai and to suppress it is to succumb to Moloch's influence. The Einblickers especially revile what they consider the false churches of old, who still cling to the whims of Moloch, and aim to oppress the true faith. Thus, they seek to emulate the great hero Luther, who walked in the path of Hermann and fought to banish the forces of the Devil-Pope from the woods of the Teutons.

For countless years, the souls on Earth have lived unknowingly under the whims and control of Satan, the creator of the Earth and of man's mortal body. It is said that when all mortals die, their souls awaken in Hades, the Devil's kingdom of the afterlife, as ghastly shades to be used by Satan to torment those still living on Earth. The only exceptions are those souls blessed by the Lord as true heroes, to enter Heaven as they die and serve in the Heavenly Host, so they may liberate Hades during the end times and bring forth all souls to the Elysian Fields - the Kingdom of God incarnated on Earth. Until then, the humble Elysians live cautious lives, wishing to save themselves from eternity in Gehenna, and blessing their fallen ancestors to protect their shades from Satan's evil machinations.

Isolated deep in the valleys of the Chitral River, the Kalash have resisted conversion to outside beliefs for millennia. Their beliefs to this very day mirror the faith described in the ancient Rigveda, yet are nonetheless syncretised to a degree with their Muslim and Dharmic neighbours. The primary belief of the Kalash is that of the Supreme God Dezao, the Yama Raja, who is the sky god Imra as the Supreme Being and Creator. Dezao is frequently worshipped alone, though even more frequently is he accompanied by a pantheon of deities that dwell in the Deva Lok'a, the unseen World of Gods. Such gods include Mitrá, the god of oaths and agreements, Bagisht, the god of wealth, Onshái, the god of family, and Wushum, the god of marriage.

The Ma'aravim, or the "Westerners" are an amalgam of Jewish sects in America, consisting of Reform, Masorati and Orthodox Jews. The Ma'aravim have long since integrated into the American system and thus are far removed from the affairs of old world Judaism. The Ma'aravim believe that the only way for the Messiah to eventually come is through 'repairing the world' through Tikkun Olam, a guideline to be righteous, kind and pious.

Originally hailing from eastern Europe, the Hasidic movement has found itself most prevalent in the United States. Initially part of the greater American Jewish community, in time, the Hasidic movement had effectively split from the rest of Ma'aravi Judaism and largely bases itself in more rural Jewish communities across the United States. While they agree about core principles of Hasidic Judaism, many sects have arose following the teachings of several important Rebbes.

The Sharifi school of thought is a sect of Islam from the Maghreb which has developed some heterodox beliefs, especially regarding who can be Caliph. In the chaos of the Post-Event world, many Muslims yearn for a Caliph to unite and defend the Ummah, but nobody has been strong enough and legitimate enough to do so in several hundred years. The Sharifi of Morocco, seeing the power of the Alaouite dynasty, came to believe that an Alaouite could become Caliph, even if he were not of the Quraysh tribe. This position has brought them into conflict with other Muslims, creating a rift in African Islam.

The fringes of the Cherifian West have always been a cause of trouble for the Makhzen overlords. In the times before the Event the Maghreb al-Awsat was the deathly rival to Morocco, and to this day it persists as the Empire's weakest link. Therefore, it is no surprise that a movement has arisen rejecting the Maghribi Caliph's right to lead the Ummah called the Thawris - the revolutionaries. These Muslims of Maliki jurisprudence still consider themselves a part of the Sharifi movement, though they are much more open to folk practices and their references mostly lie outside of the Moroccan monarchy, working through lodges of exalted Marabouts. They show special reverence to Sufi sheikhs memorialised in thousands of monuments peppering the Algerian countryside, martyrised by the general of Dajjal Yad Al-Hamra in ancient times, which had once conquered the Maghreb and was defeated in the field of battle by the army of Islam. The Thawris now seek to emulate their victories by freeing the opressed wherever they may be through Jihad.

The Maronite Catholic Church is an Eastern Catholic church that has been in full communion with Rome for centuries. Though they use a different Rite to celebrate the Liturgy than Latin Catholics,they have no substantial theological differences,and thus enjoy good relations with each other. The Maronite Church exists primarily in Lebanon,and is led by the Patriarch of the Levant.

Founded by the prophet Mubarak, a scholar, adventurer, and now the Mahdi who found the truth on the history of the great Judges deep in the ancestral ruins of old Iraq. Mesopotamianism is internally considered an Islamic faith, but are denounced by the wider Islamic world as mushrikun - polytheists, for their reverence of ancestral Mesopotamian gods. Namely, the Mesopotamians revere figures such as Ishtar and Ea, whom they consider to be karubiyin loyal to Allah. They believe that these archangels, now carved into millennia old stones, guided old Mesopotamians before Islam. Under their guidance, the ancient Mesopotamians founded the Empire of Mesopotamia, which ruled the orient for millennia as the one true domain of Allah, until they were shattered by Iblis as revenge for being cast from heaven. The Mesopotamians now believe it is their destiny to restore the ancient empire as the one true ummah and usher in a new golden age.

First spread to India by Saint Thomas the Apostle over 25 centuries ago, the Nasrani sect of Christianity has always been a minority in India. With the chaos of the Event cutting India off from most outside communication, the various Nasrani Churches (both those in communion with the Pope and those in communion with the Eastern Church) united together for the sake of convenience. The example of several holy men has caused the Nasranis to grow in popularity over the last few decades, to the point where they are a majority in Kerala, in the southwestern coast of India, though they are still a minority overall.

More similar to followers a philosophical belief than a religion, Nobelians believe that Knowledge is what drove the people before the Event to greatness. Among those men, the greatest in all the fields of Knowledge were Nobel and his laureates, whose discoveries led humanity forward. However, the Merchant of Death always whispers in the hears of those willing to listen, and so it was that the glory of humanity also created great destruction, until the world was returned to the darkness of ignorance. The Nobelians struggle to return humanity to its former glory, believing they can recreate the greatness of the old world.

Hailing from the boreal reaches of Siberia, Razumnost is based on the concept of the Noosphere, the global consciousness of the world - an atmosphere of people's thoughts orbiting around the earth, powered entirely by humanity's collective reason. The Noosphere gives power to the World Mind, a divine phenomenon capable of altering and improving reality. It was, however, severely damaged by the Event, caused by the civilisations of the Old World growing so illogical and unreasonable that the Noosphere collapsed into itself, no longer able to power the World Mind. With the World Mind being so weak, people's conscious bodies - their shades in the Noosphere - split from their physical selves. As a result, if humanity were to ever return to the heights reached by the pre-Event world, they first need to channel and merge with their conscious bodies in order to restore the full potential of their nous, and give power back to the World Mind.

One of many post-Event religions originating in France, the Novelist faith believes that the truth of the origin of the world and all life is not contained in a single book, but is fragmented among many of the books that humanity produced. The Novel, the magnum opus penned by the author-god Eru and brought to Earth by the Valar at the beginning of time, is divided into various great ages and was, is, and will be revealed to the faithful across time. Novelists trace their founding to the reign of Charlemagne, the first ruler of Númenor and all of mankind during the First Age of Men. The line of Charlemagne, however, lies shattered - the loss of the legendary sword Durendal during the great Quest of the Third Age led to the deluge known as the Event. This calamity was the greatest that men had ever seen, leading to the loss of magic, the fall of empires, and uncountable deaths. Thus, they find themselves in the Fifth Age of Men, and the great line of Charlemagne still lives. Novelists believe that men of other nations still cling to the previous age, adorning the crowns and flags of realms that were burned to ash during the Event - a mistake that should be corrected in time for the great coming Quest of the current era. The Novelists hope to restore the fragments of Durendal, the legendary sword of change destined to defeat the great evil and bring forth the next age, and prevent it from mirroring the great calamity of the previous. Their gallant knights, a spiritual caste of rulers and warriors meant to ascend to Charlemagne's army in the heavens, train all their lives for the great task ahead of them, for only a virtuous and skilled knight is fit to fight the great evil next to their Taxiarch. Though the people of the book may be disunited and disorganised, still feeling the salt in the wounds from Númenor's collapse, they all proudly sing the songs of Charlemagne and Roland, an unbroken line of the gallant knights of the occident.

The Old Believers trace their founding to an event called the Raskol, long before the Deluge. They maintain that the corrupt Patriach Nikon caused the Raskol by calling for mass reform of the Church, a deed that only could have been commanded by Satan himself. As a result of Nikon's perversions, the Russian Orthodox Church was split into two - the Old Believer churches of the faithful, and the degenerate main Church that eventually devolved into Tsarism, a stain in the eyes of the Lord. The first Old Believers escaped into the remote and inhospitable wilderness of Russia, and when the Earth was destroyed by God, they persisted and reorganised. Split from the Catholic church in days lost in the mist of time, the Orthodox Church grew to a great extent before the event, stretching from Greece to Russia. After the Event, however, much like the other Christian faiths, much ground was lost to new faiths as people turned to forgotten gods and new deities. However, thanks to the Nistrenian Empire, not all hope is lost for the faith that once held together many great Empires.

The main branch of the Jewish faith, the Orthodox kept the ancient traditions alive in the changing world before the Event. And once the Event fell upon humanity, more and more Jews joined the Orthodox school, which became the main branch of Judaism once again. Most Jews today are part of the Orthodox faith, and any other is considered an heretic.

Split away from the main Orthodox church in the deep mists of time over the true nature of Christ, the Hay Arak'elakans take the Miaphysite stance as was proclaimed by Saint Cyril of Alexandria, which stated that Christ had a nature which was equally divine and mortal. In the time since the Event, the Church has greatly assisted its Kingdom in holding back the Yarsani tide to the south.

It showed him that Rome had become corrupt once more and that the Vicar of Christ should no longer be seated in that wretched city, instead demanding it should be seated in the righteous city of Seville, and if this did not occur a great calamity would befall the world. He attempted to warn the church of the vision, who refused to place their faith in him. In preparation for the oncoming calamity he sought to gather as many followers as possible and establish a new church in the world which would come after, becoming the first Sevillian Pope. When he revealed to the people of Spain that it was the Papacy who had led them to the apocalypse, many of the most fundamentalist Catholics who in the years before the event had grown tired with the growing progressivism of the church flocked to this new church's banners after the event, believing it to better represent the church of old. With all of Spain now following the Sevillian Pope, the faith can now hope to crush the misguided Catholics and their Pope in Rome, and return the world under the shield of the one true church.

Unlike mainstream Tsarism, Petrism states that there are no more Tsars to be blessed in this world. Petrists claim that the unbroken line of Tsars ended with the death of the almighty Peter the Great, Tsar of Man. Petrists adamantly believe that all Tsars after Peter were nothing but imposters, with their degeneracy in life a clear display of falsehood. Tsar Nicholas was a weak and incompetent man, deceived by the demon Rasputin and ultimately killed and consumed by the wicked Lord Stalin, the personification of all evil. The death of Tsar Peter was the death of Mother Russia, with the events that followed culminating in the death of the world itself. Thus, the most important belief of the Petrists is that the apotheosis of Tsar Peter was the last, and will be the last once Peter returns to Earth in flesh to gather the faithful and bring forth a new Great Russia.

Heimwehism is a sect of Lutheranism originating from Germany, which believes that the aggression and pride of the antediluvian peoples destroyed the Old World, dooming all civilisations. Germania, guided by a Kanzler, was one of these civilisations, showing her many faces through the ages, being there to calm her people, giving them freedom like no other, and providing for their needs. But the Devil decieved Germania, giving her delusions of grandeur and a right to rule over the world, and made her unleash her wrath on earth, causing the Event. For this Heimwehist believe they must pay penance for God, to feel the pain the peoples of old felt, preach for peace among everyone, and rid themselves of sin, for one must be a Kanzler of themselves before they can be a Kanzler of Germania.

The arrival of the Mashiach to Jerusalem was met by most Jews with reasonable suspicion, though a majority would accept his claim for the title of Mashiach ben David. Many of the Goalim publicly contested his claim to messiahship, claiming the events surrounding his rise to fame conflict with historical Jewish texts. After his death, they became the majority position within Israel, commanding the respect of many of the more conservative and orthodox Jews. The followers of this movement, dubbed the Mikraists, seek to find the legendary Mashiach ben Yosef, meant to fufil the rest of the prophecy and lead the Jewish people to the Messianic Age by cleansing the Land of Israel of evil and building a proper Third Temple.

Once a prominent school of thought in Judaism, the Reform faith has since the Event fallen out of favour in most Jewish communities. Today, only a handful of people still preach the idea that the Reform faith is the one true school of Judaism.
